definition: to fall/to drop/socket (loanword for "plug")
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: When the butt was removed the face flopped back over to the left.
sentences.chinese: 当枪托一拿掉，他的脸又重新扑落到左边。

sentences.english: Sword rectracted, my eyes already hurting at the sight of the blood spilling and the figures dropping to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 剑入鞘，我的双目已不能再忍睹溅血与扑落的对手。

definition: splash
very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
to swat/(of wings) to flap
to tumble
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to shake out
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
to go off like a rocket/to rocket
to start in surprise/to give a jolt of surprise
(literary) suddenly
to revolve
midair
to leap/to spring/to throw oneself
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
